intro: Ammi acaule, commonly known as the naked stem cow-wheat, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open habitats. It has a short stem with no leaves below the flower cluster, giving it its common name. Ammi acaule is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
